resources.string: Choose the number of items to keep in the history(Pinned don\'t count)
Choose which apps should not be copied from (ex. Password managers).
Single Click : Pastes\nLong Click : Opens ClipBoard\n*Requires Reboot
Single Click : Opens ClipBoard\nLong Click : Pastes\n*Requires Reboot
Add CB button to selection menu\n*Requires Reboot
Close the clipboard directly after pasting
Use a background service to monitor copied text for MIUI and Samsung Roms\n*disables Blacklisting
This might be needed to keep the service running (especially on low RAM devices)
You have both Xposed and Accessibility enabled
Switch to using the Accessibility, it uses less RAM and does NOT need the Notification
You can use this app by either Xposed or Accessibility
You need to enable the module through the Xposed Installer
This app requires Accessibility to be turned on
alternative ways to open the clipboard
Click to apply\nLong click to delete
Use the line to match the height of the clipboard to the height of the keyboard
Unfortunately this app requires Xposed, or Jelly Bean 4.3 and above
Check Native Clip Board then reboot
Un-Check Native Clip Board then reboot
Click on Native Clip Board then turn On
Click on Native Clip Board then turn Off

This is used to detect the double tap and monitor the clipboard

-'Observe your actions': to be notified of the double tap.
-'Retrieve window content': to retrieve the double tapped text field.
-'Observe text you type': Only Home,Recent, and back are observed.
Due to limitations in Chrome when pasting a clip all previous text in the field will be replaced
Native clipboard provides seamless access to any text you\'ve copied without leaving your current app
Select this or long click on \'PASTE\'
\nThis can be later changed under Advanced
Enable the module from the Xposed Installer, reboot. Then come back to continue the tutorial
Each has it\'s advantages and disadvantages click on the button below to visit XDA forum to see the comparison
Position the clipboard on the opposite side of the screen, so that the text field is not covered
You can switch keyboard by using one of three ways:
1-Using the option in the notification panel \n2-Using the bottom in the Navigation, in bottom right corner of the screen \n3-If you are using Google Keyboard use the globe switch
Go to the settings and enable one of the two keyboards and then click back

-Integrated:
 Behaves like an additional language to Google Keyboard 
(Not recommended if you have more than one language)

-Independent:
 Behaves like a separate keyboard 
Use this if you don't use Google Keyboard or don't want to pass my keyboard each time you change the language in Google keyboard
Do you have more then one keyboard language?
Do you mind passing the clipboard each time you need to switch language ?
Use a keyboard to access copied text, in apps where double tap doesn\'t work
Monitor Back and Home to close the clipboard when clicked\nXiaomi users turn this off for one handed mode to work
Use a keyboard filled with your copied texts for apps where the clipboard does not open.\nFor example: Office apps, Web browsers
